pageContext.claim: “And we're replacing the previous administration's job-crushing Clean Power Plan and putting our miners back to work. And they're back to work all over the country.”
pageContext.analysis: This is exaggerated. The United States has added 13,000 mining jobs since Trump took office, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, out of 4.9 million new jobs total. That's about half of the 28,400 job-loss in this industry since its most recent employment peak in October 2011.
